title: How to write an English novel if my English is not great - Quora

response.answer_text: You just draft your novel as fast as you can while the ideas are still hot. Then revise it again and again then have a pro review it. Design a fancy cover page and sell it on Amazon and Barns and Noble. Have your compatriots buy them and give glorious reviews. I tell you: it’s an easy scam
By writing it. Most novels are not “great.” Or even good, for that matter. Didn’t stop their authors from writing them—sadly.

I write in Finnish, but the venue for my stories is Italy 1250-2000. I know very little Italian, even though I have sung a couple of operas in Italian. To get in the mood, I watch Italian films, in Finland they are not spoken in Finnish, so I hear the rhythm of the language, its feel and the taste of life. And I'm watching Sophia Lorenia. I would watch Sophia Loren even if I didn’t write. If I live I watch Sophia Loren. If I do not look at Sophia Lorenia I'm dead. Life is Sophia Loren.
